result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin Thomas Samolyk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 7/5/16 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Consecutive to: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Consecutive to any sentence with credit for 72 days served. Straight time. Court recommends against electronic monitoring.

***3-26-2015/ELLEN R. BROSTROM***
Per Court order judgment of conviction shall be amended to reflect that counts one and two are consecutive to each other but concurrent with the sentence imposed in case 13CF003154.

It is further ordered that the 72 days of credit ordered in 14CF001719 shall apply only to the sentence on count one.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin Thomas Samolyk

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: ORDER AMENDED JUDGMENT OF CONVICTION, signed and filed. lms
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Ellen R. Brostrom, Br. 6, for review. jbs
Copy of sentencing transcript from 7/2/14 filed.
Letter from Department of Corrections seeking clarification of sentence structure.

Defendant Martin Thomas Samolyk in court with attorney Cynthia M Wynn.  Defendant Martin Thomas Samolyk in custody.  Brad A Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

COUNT 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

COUNT 3 & 4:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 3 & 4 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
COUNT 1 & 2:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 72 days served; Straight time. Court recommends against electronic monitoring. 

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 7/5/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Attorney Cynthia M Wynn in court, defendant Martin Thomas Samolyk not in court, in custody.  Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DTC referral.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Martin Thomas Samolyk in court with attorney Cynthia M Wynn.  Defendant Martin Thomas Samolyk in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Original information filed.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Martin Thomas Samolyk in court with attorney Cynthia M Wynn.  Defendant Martin Thomas Samolyk in custody.  Denis Stingl for Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Arraignment scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed, no alcohol.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Martin Thomas Samolyk in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Martin Thomas Samolyk in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pleads Not Guilty for COUNT 1 and 2. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
